text: The odd-year municipal political cycle typically sees much lower turnout than the even-year elections for state, federal and some local offices. There's a bill to combine ALL elections to the even-year cycle, which you can see here: https://www.leg.state.nv.us/Session/80th2019/Reports/history.cfm?ID=98 …
author: SteveSebelius

text: The @CityOfLasVegas will save some coin holding its Ward 2 special election in June. Filing for the seat vacated by ex-Councilman Steve Seroka is March 25-28 at City Hall; early voting May 25-June 7, and Election Day is June 11.
author: SteveSebelius

text: The bill to expand the Clark County Commission from 7 to 9 members has passed a Senate committee and now heads to the full Senate. Government expanding before our very eyes! (BTW, for comparison, Los Angeles County has nearly five times our population and just 5 supervisors.)

text: Commissioner Larry Brown moves to support Senate-caucus supported candidate Marsha Washington. Motion approved unanimously. Washington will replace Kelvin Atkinson and fill the remainder of his term until 2020.

text: Assemblywoman Dina Neal voted down, 4-2.

text: Looks like the votes are not there to appoint Assemblywoman Dina Neal, despite a motion to appoint her to the Senate made by Commissioner Lawrence Weekly. Commissioners cite preference of Senate caucus.

text: Assemblywoman Dina Neal says that even if she doesn't get the county commission's appointment to her father's SD-4 seat, she will run for it anyway in 2020.

text: My original comment (please read it again) said that background checks do not offend the Second Amendment. For that, you would have to read additional material. Then again, the Constitution doesn't mention the Air Force, either, and I presume you agree that THAT's constitutional?
author: SteveSebelius

text: See, now THAT is a personal insult. I think you DO know the difference after all. However, I greet your remark with complacency.
author: SteveSebelius

text: Interesting, since background checks have stopped hundreds of thousands of people prohibited from buying guns legally from getting them. This would suggest that they DO make it harder for such people to buy guns.
author: SteveSebelius

text: Happy Sunshine Week! This bill -- which dropped today -- contains some important and much-needed reforms that will benefit the public when they seek to inspect and copy public records. https://www.leg.state.nv.us/App/NELIS/REL/80th2019/Bill/6505/Overview … #SunshineWeek
author: SteveSebelius

text: There are instances where states have passed even stricter laws than the federal government (i.e. assault weapons bans). But this in no way undercuts the constitutionality of background checks, which, interestingly, are conducted with the aid of the federal government.
author: SteveSebelius

text: You're mistaken. I said your attempted POINT was pedantic. I did not characterize YOU. I have high hopes for you as a person to do better.
author: SteveSebelius

text: B-ground checks HAVE been tested in federal courts: 2 district court judges have upheld them. The Supreme Court has upheld reasonable restrictions on the 2nd Amendment. IF the issue ever gets to the courts (no appeals court has weighed in yet) I am confident they will uphold. 2/2
author: SteveSebelius

text: No, my comment indicated that "background checks are perfectly consistent with the Second Amendment." It didn't say they were MENTIONED in the Second Amendment, which is why I questioned your somewhat pedantic comment. 1/2
author: SteveSebelius

text: The @lvchamber has released its endorsements in muni elections ahead of early voting Saturday. Mayor Carolyn Goodman, Councilman Cedric Crear get the nods in Las Vegas; incumbent council members Pamela Goynes-Brown and Richard Cherchio in NLV. 1/2
author: SteveSebelius

text: So your contention is that ALL background checks are unconstitutional, then? I'm sure if you give that a little bit of thought, you'll realize how silly (and legally untenable) your position is. Go ahead, I'll wait.

text: Interesting. But given that marijuana is also a prohibited substance and you are considered under the influence with a very low amount of metabolites in your system, aren't we talking about the same thing here?

text: Presidential candidate Rep. Tulsi Gabbard, D-Hawaii, is not only having a town hall on Monday at 2 p.m. at the Asian Cultural Center, she's also having a meet and greet luau at 6 p.m. that night at the United Way. I could really get used to these early presidential visits!
author: SteveSebelius
